Being a player myself, I appreciate a lot of the effort
that you guys are putting into making gladiator levels.

However, there seems to me to be an all too common theme
in these levels that takes away some of the enjoyment
from the game.  A majority of the levels out there are
designed for high-level teams that, apparently, you need
to have played the game out in full and developed an
effective team.

Why is this a problem?  I'm sure many of you on this
list will agree with me when I say that the most
enjoyable part of Glad is creating your beginning team
which may consist of any number of useful entities
(druids, my favorite class, are especially fun early
on!).  Playing a team that you have already played to
death in other scenarios is not as much fun in my
humble opinion.

My proposition is that the builders out there make
levels that can be played by a brand new team.  Make a
chain of scenarios that start easy (as in level 1 easy)
and build up to a plot.  Is this not the most fun thing
about Gladiator?

Sure, developing your character to maximum-power is a
lot of fun as well, but I prefer the fun of hiring five
soldiers for fodder and running them at the enemy while
your main characters gain experience in more creative
ways.

Thoughts?

  --moontug
